{"blocks":[{"key":"552d6","text":"Mix each tube vigorously by vortexing for 3–5 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc62p","text":"Allow all tubes to incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes, then proceed to “Read standards and samples”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mvs2","text":"On the Home screen of the Qubit™ 3 Fluorometer, press DNA, then select 1X dsDNA HS as the assay type. The Read standards screen is displayed. {"blocks":[{"key":"356lk","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #1 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read standard. When the reading is complete (~3 seconds), remove Standard #1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ng3a","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #2 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read standard. When the reading is complete, remove Standard #2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e1ef","text":"The instrument displays the results on the Read standard screen. For information on interpreting the calibration results, refer to the Qubit™ Fluorometer User Guide, available for download at thermofisher.com/qubit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9k96d","text":"On the assay screen, select the sample volume and units:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8liij","text":"Press the + or – buttons on the wheel, or anywhere on the wheel itself, to select the sample volume added to the assay tube (from 1–20µL).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cs6nv","text":"From the unit dropdown menu, select the units for the output sample concentration (in this case choose ng/µL).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"937sm","text":"Insert a sample tube into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read tube. When the reading is complete (~3 seconds), remove the sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dutee","text":"The top value (in large font) is the concentration of the original sample and the bottom value is the dilution concentration. {"blocks":[{"key":"25u89","text":"Repeat step 14 until all samples have been read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8latl","text":"Carefully record all results and store run file from the Qubit on a memory stick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2f33v","text":"We established a protocol for fast, cost efficient Sars-CoV-2 sequencing with little as possible hands-on time (around 3h in total, excluding RNA extraction). The whole Sequencing can be done in one working day, including the bioinformatic pipeline. The cost per sample accumulates at around 40$, with already isolated RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8stc6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5g28","text":"We adapted and simplified existing workflows using the ‘midnight’ 1,200 bp amplicon split primer sets for PCR, which produce tiled overlapping amplicons covering almost all of the SARS-CoV-2 genome. Subsequently, we applied the Oxford Nanopore Rapid barcoding protocol and the portable MinION Mk1C sequencer in combination with the ARTIC bioinformatics pipeline. We tested the simplified and less time-consuming workflow on confirmed SARS-CoV-2-positive specimens from clinical routine and identified pre-analytical parameters, which may help to decrease the rate of sequencing failures. Duration of the complete pipeline was approx. 7 hrs for one specimen and approx. 11 hrs for 12 multiplexed barcoded specimens.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69bng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsss3","text":"This protocol is a modified version of Nikki Freed and Olin Silanders protocol. To get information such as Primers, visit their protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"c6am3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qv81","text":"Nikki Freed, Olin Silander 2020. nCoV-2019 sequencing protocol (RAPID barcoding, 1200bp amplicon).doi: 10.1093/biomethods/bpaa014","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3afrk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9loo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o72v","text":"Our peer-reviewed paper is available here: https://www.mdpi.com/2076-2607/9/12/2598","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":40}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"59281C50CFA011EB990067CEF35BE2B1","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bgggjttw"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"20C76D0067DC11ECBA2B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.mdpi.com/2076-2607/9/12/2598"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ml23","text":"For whole genome sequencing using combined RT-PCR, samples with a Ct \u003c20 are suitable.
